meanings.definition: The quality of being easily affected by heat.
meanings.sent1: The thermolability of the chocolate caused it to melt quickly in the sun.
meanings.sent2: The thermolability of the ice cream made it difficult to transport in the hot weather.
meanings.sent3: The thermolability of the candle made it a challenge to keep it from turning into a puddle.
meanings.sent4: Her patience had the thermolability of a snowflake, easily disappearing under pressure.
meanings.sent5: The thermolability of the wax crayons was evident as they softened in the warm classroom.

meanings.definition: The ability to be altered or destroyed by high temperatures.
meanings.sent1: The thermolability of the plastic bottles made them warp in the dishwasher.
meanings.sent2: The thermolability of the delicate flowers caused them to wither in the scorching sun.
meanings.sent3: The thermolability of the ice sculpture turned it into a puddle at the outdoor event.
meanings.sent4: His dreams had the thermolability of ice, fading away when faced with reality.
meanings.sent5: The thermolability of the chocolate was evident as it melted in her hand under the sun.
